text: hey <@UUVQKV146>, check this, and i think you can try with `iframe` type <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-extensions/crm-extensions-overview#managing-cards-dev-account>

I've just launched a new site on HubSpot and am having an issue with one of the pages. Can someone take a look at this page and tell me why none of the links are working in the main page body!?! (It's the only page I built that uses the drag and drop page builder. All the rest were coded templates and they all work fine). Here is the page: <https://www.smoothiebox.com/berry>

this isn't a HubSpot issue, but i figure yall might be a good resource for this. our hero is rendering differently in firefox and it's driving me nuts

the source code and png file have a blue background - specifically, #1B71A4

this renders juuuuuust fine in every browser that i have tested except for firefox. firefox renders the background as a different shade of blue - #1370A6 and the background of the PNG as yet another shade of blue - #1C71A4

any ideas?
you see that hex code in firefox?

ah, you're right about that much. it was due to the different color profiles across monitors i'm using.

there is still an issue, though - the background color of the image still renders slightly differently than the CSS specified color - this is more or less noticeable depending on the display. any idea what might cause the PNG to render differently in FF?
It seems to do the same thing with a JPG, for whatever it's worth.
update the png to embed the color space
Yeah, I had tried that. As a sanity check, I tried yours too. Both times ended up with a difference between the two, still.
left with the one i changed and the right is the original
i can't replicate that. i wish i could at least get it to consistently render the image bg and the other bg, but it won't. at least not on my displays.
i'm going to give up on this and we'll use a transparent bg on the image on a later rev
weird.  i have a pretty nice monitor and embedding color space and making sure it is srgb made it blend nicely
but transparent bg is a good idea.
